verses.roman:
sa yadā vitathodyogo
nirviṇṇaḥ syād dhanehayā
mat-paraiḥ kṛta-maitrasya
kariṣye mad-anugraham

synonyms: saḥ—he; yadā—when; vitatha—useless; udyogaḥ—his attempt; nirviṇṇaḥ—frustrated; syāt—becomes; dhana—for money; īhayā—with his endeavor; mat—to Me; paraiḥ—with those who are devoted; kṛta—for him who has made; maitrasya—friendship; kariṣye—I will show; mat—My; anugraham—mercy.
translation: When he becomes frustrated in his attempts to make money and instead befriends My devotees, I bestow My special mercy upon him.
